thread.title: Not Sargun, but Sanjeeda will dance to Nacchan Farrate
thread.title_full: Not Sargun, but Sanjeeda will dance to Nacchan Farrate - The Times of India

author: Tanvi Trivedi
title: Not Sargun, but Sanjeeda will dance to Nacchan Farrate
text:
Item songs from Bollywood films are now a common feature in TV shows now. In 'Bhaghyalakshmi', several actresses have already performed to different item numbers and the latest to join the gang is Sanjeeda Sheikh.
She will perform to Nacchan Farrate from the film All is Well. However, sources have informed us that actress Sargun Mehta was originally offered the part. The actress and the makers, however, did not agree on the budget after which Sanjeeda was roped in. Says Sargun, "I love dancing and had it worked out, it would have been great."
READ: Sanjeeda Sheikh: Aamir's just perfect for me
Meanwhile, Sanjeeda is excited about performing to the peppy number. She says, "My husband Aamir and I love dancing at events and TV shows. You get a chance to perform to hit filmi numbers. It gives a good visibility, specially when you are not acting."
Aamir Ali and Sanjeeda Sheikh: This is the best phase for TV actors in films. Click Here! to know the reason. Aamir Ali and Sanjeeda invited for the India Day Parade abroad. Click Here! to read the whole article.

WATCH: Bhaghyalakshmi - Episode 6
2015: TV shows to look forward this year of 75 Aashka juggles four shows at a time: Aashka Goradia is set to host a travel show. With this, she will be juggling four projects simultaneously, including Bharat Ka Veer Putra — Maharana Pratap, Baal Veer and host of a finance show Get Rich With Aashka. She will be seen travelling across 30-odd destinations in India in this show. She says, “I am excited to tour around the country and show the viewers a different side of India. In our first schedule, I have done everything — from climbing an elephant to ziplining. Rather than being just in front of the camera, I enjoyed each place as if I was holidaying there. Life is a book and those who don’t travel, read only a page and I believe in reading and enjoying the entire book!” Documentary on A. R. Rahman to premiere on October 26: ' Jai Ho', a 90-minute documentary tracing the journey of music maestro A. R. Rahman, is all set to premiere on October 26 on Discovery channel. The Oscar-winning composer said initially, he did not find it "necessary" to have a documentary based on him, but later director Umesh Aggarwal convinced him. "There were lot of offers before to do a documentary on me, but I felt it was not necessary. And after the Oscars and the brouhaha happened, I felt that people could get some kind of inspiration with my life through the journey of my life, through the way I'm making music," Rahman said. "And then Umesh, an award-winning filmmaker, contacted me and he said that initially it was only for the consulates all over. It was the kind of exposure which was good, but I didn't know that all this would happen," he added. However, the composer added that he "cannot watch myself". "People living abroad and having the Indian flag, they deserve to know about the people of India. I didn't know it'll come out charmingly like how it's made. I cannot watch myself and hate to watch myself," he said. Aggarwal said that it's the first "definite feature" on Rahman. "I am confident that this film will convey his astonishing success and global phenomenon," he said. Shot across the world, the film includes interviews of Aamir Khan, Danny Boyle, Mani Ratnam, Gulzar, Ashutosh Gowarikar, Shekhar Kapoor, Subhash Ghai and composer Andrew Lloyd Webber among others. The film traces Rahman's journey from achieving superstar status in India with numerous hits in a very short time to working with big names in the west. Some of his personal experiences are also going to be showcased in the film. "Jai Ho" has been created for the Public Service Broadcasting Trust. Mahesh Bhatt gives insights into his new TV show: Filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt, who has been associated with the Hindi film industry for over four decades, will soon be narrating and exploring tales of some of Bollywood’s most iconic personalities in the TV show 'Khwaabon ka Safar with Mahesh Bhatt', which will go on air October 19. At the launch of the show here, Bhatt said that when he was approached by the makers, he immediately agreed to take it forward as he felt humbled to get such an opportunity. “When I heard the whole idea and the kind of narratives that have been fashioned, I was humbled by the idea that I had to come face to face with my own ignorance. I did not know all these people whom I claimed to know, I did not know that the great Indian filmmaker V. Shantaram made a living by giving out lamps at theatres while the artists performed and it was there where Shantaram ji first learnt what drama was all about,” he said at a media interaction here. “It is a unique show where I am learning about my own ancestors, and there was a time which existed prior to even my birth,” he added. At the press conference, a video clipping giving a sneak peak into the journey of the show, which will be aired on The EPIC Channel, was also showcased. Talking about the show, Mahesh Samat, managing director, The EPIC Channel, shared that the show wil bring forth the journey of young, ambitious people who stood for what they believed in and made their dream come true against all odds. Upen Patel and Karishma Tanna to judge reality show 'Love School'
Upen Patel is looking forward to hosting a reality show 'Love School' on television with his ladylove Karishma Tanna. It’s for the first time the popular couple will be seen judging a reality show on television.
The youth reality series titled 'Love School' will be aired on MTV channel and is set to go on floors from end of next month. Both Upen and Karishma are looking forward to judging the reality show. Interestingly, the couple who had participated in the dance reality show, 'Nach Baliye 7' this year, was earlier approached for another reality show, Power Couple but things didn't work out.
A source close to the couple says, “This is the first time Upen will be judging a show and he’s thrilled to do so with Karishma by his side. It’s an interesting concept based on human relationships and they are glad to do this together.”
Upen informs,"Love is a strong beautiful feeling. However, every now and then one needs to work on keeping that spark alive. Even more so in this easy come easy go age. With this show you will see there is so much more to me then just being stylish or an Actor in films and thanks to MTV I get a chance to reach out to the youth and show a much more in depth side to me that will really connect to the real life couples and make a positive difference in their life's. It's amazing that MTV see us as role models for the youth and Me and Karishma are going to take on this role with all our heart. MTV 'Love School' is going to be a great show and set an example for all young couples on how to nurture relationships."​ Saanvi learns Bengali for new show: Saanvi Talwar will be playing a classical singer who belongs to West Bengal in the upcoming show 'Yeh Kahaan Aa Gaye Hum'. The actress has been taking lessons in Bengali from Kali Prasad, who plays her father on the show. She tells us that she dedicates time to learn new Bengali words from Prasad every day and the actor gladly obliges. “Learning Bengali will not only help me get the diction for the show right, but it’s always nice to learn a new language. Plus, Bengali is one of the sweetest languages, so I’m having a great time learning it,” Saanvi says. Stay updated on the go with Times of India News App. Click here to download it for your device.
